item.title: Word of the Day: anachronism
item.description: This word has appeared in 33 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Jimmy Lai Faces Up to Life in a Hong Kong Jail After Guilty Verdicts
item.description: Jimmy Lai, the publisher of a popular tabloid, was convicted of national security charges on Monday after spending decades supporting the city’s vanquished pro-democracy movement.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Stevenson and David Pierson
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Jimmy Lai in Hong Kong in 2019. Mr. Lai, who has been behind bars for five years, received guilty verdicts in a national security trial on Monday.

item.title: China Approaches First Investment Decline in 3 Decades
item.description: A broad measure of investment fell more than 10 percent in November, continuing a recent reversal and signaling the depth of China’s property crisis.
item.dc:creator: Daisuke Wakabayashi

media:content.media:credit: Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A residential complex being built by Vanke in Nanjing, China. Vanke is the latest developer in financial distress as property investment has plunged.

item.title: How the Bondi Beach Community Rushed to Help Shooting Victims
item.description: I lived and worked around Bondi for years. The emergency response tells you everything you need to know about the area.
item.dc:creator: Damien Cave

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A family embraces at a flower memorial by a lifeguard tower on Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, on Monday.

item.title: Australia Mourns After Bondi Beach Shooting
item.description: The belongings of people at Bondi Beach during a deadly shooting were lined up on the sand on Monday. People brought flowers and flags were lowered for the victims of the attack on a Jewish festival.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times

item.title: Kenia apuesta su economía a mujeres dispuestas a arriesgarlo todo
item.description: Una investigación reveló que la explotación de las trabajadoras enviadas a Arabia Saudita empieza en su país de origen.
item.dc:creator: Abdi Latif Dahir, Justin Scheck and Kiana Hayeri

media:content.media:credit: Kiana Hayeri for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Emily in Paris,’ Plus 10 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The Netflix rom-com series is back for a fifth season, and David Letterman’s interview show returns.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:credit: Giulia Parmigiani/Netflix
media:content.media:description: Lily Collins in “Emily in Paris.”

item.title: Live Updates: Australian Police Plan to Charge Suspect in Bondi Massacre
item.description: Officials said a father and son killed at least 15 people at a Jewish holiday celebration. More than three dozen others were hospitalized, including a surviving gunman.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times

item.title: Rob Reiner, Actor Who Went on to Direct Classic Films, Dies at 78
item.description: Mr. Reiner, who was in “All in the Family,” directed films including “This Is Spinal Tap,” “When Harry Met Sally …,” “The Princess Bride” and “A Few Good Men.”
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs

media:content.media:credit: Aaron Rapoport/Corbis/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Rob Reiner in Los Angeles in 1986.

item.title: Live Updates: Hollywood Director Rob Reiner and His Wife Are Found Dead
item.description: The Los Angeles Police Department said it was investigating an apparent homicide at the Reiners’ home. The couple’s family said they were “heartbroken by this sudden loss.”
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Matt Winkelmeyer/Getty Images for Human Rights Campaign
media:content.media:description: Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, in Los Angeles in March.

item.title: No Corrections: Dec. 15, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Dec. 15, 2025.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Phil Upchurch, Jazz and Blues Guitarist And Sideman to Constellation of Stars, 84
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, December 15, 2025.

item.title: Two Bodies Found at Home Owned by Director Rob Reiner
item.description: The deaths were confirmed by the Los Angeles mayor, Karen Bass. The Los Angeles Police Department said it is investigating “an apparent homicide” at their home.
item.dc:creator: Matt Stevens, Shawn Hubler, Julia Jacobs and Nicole Sperling

item.title: Trump Said It Would Be Easy to Free Jimmy Lai. He Should Prove It.
item.description: The Hong Kong publisher’s fate will reveal whether democracies still have the resolve to defend their own values.
item.dc:creator: Mark L. Clifford
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:credit: Anthony Wallace/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

item.title: Emergency Responders Recount Horror of Sydney Shooting
item.description: Two medical professionals who live near Bondi Beach, where gunmen attacked a Hanukkah festival on Sunday, described a harrowing scene.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Items left behind at the scene near Bondi Beach on Monday.

item.title: ‘It: Welcome to Derry’ Season 1 Finale Recap: The Mist
item.description: A strange fog envelops the town, sowing fear and chaos. The monster is loose.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:credit: Brooke Palmer/HBO
media:content.media:description: Turns out Pennywise (Bill Skarsgard) still has a few tricks up his big pouffy clown sleeve.

item.title: Jeanette Winter, Who Told Children About Artists’ Lives, Dies at 86
item.description: Her picture books found models of perseverance and imagination in figures like Emily Dickinson, Georgia O’Keeffe and Benny Goodman.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

media:content.media:credit: Allyn Johnston
media:content.media:description: Jeanette Winter in 2017. She was the writer, illustrator or both of more than 65 children’s books, many of them biographies of great artists.

item.title: A ‘Small Place’ Copes With Unimaginable Tragedy After Brown Shooting
item.description: The killing of two college students brought an unwelcome and unusual spotlight to the mayor of Providence, R.I., a place where many residents know each other.
item.dc:creator: Mark Arsenault

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Hundreds of people gathered for a candlelight vigil at Lippitt Memorial Park in Providence, R.I., on Sunday night.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s Life, in Photos and Video
item.description: He attributed his rags-to-riches ascent to the freedoms of Hong Kong, and has paid a hefty price for defending them.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

item.title: California Hires Former C.D.C. Officials Who Criticized Trump Administration
item.description: A former director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and a former chief medical officer of the agency will advise the state on public health issues.
item.dc:creator: Laurel Rosenhall and Apoorva Mandavilli

item.title: Live Updates: Hong Kong Court Finds Jimmy Lai Guilty in National Security Trial
item.description: Officials had cast Mr. Lai, a pro-democracy media tycoon, as the mastermind of protests that roiled the city in 2019. He could face life in prison.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

item.title: U.S. Military Plane and JetBlue Flight Nearly Collided Over Caribbean, Radio Traffic Shows
item.description: The Air Force refueling tanker was flying without its location transponder activated and could not be detected by air traffic control.
item.dc:creator: Riley Mellen
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Ricardo Arduengo/Reuters
media:content.media:description: A U.S. Air Force air-to-air refueling tanker took off from an airport in St. Croix in late November. A similar type of aircraft nearly collided with a JetBlue flight on Friday over the Caribbean, according to air traffic control radio communications.

item.title: Suspects in Bondi Beach Shooting Identified as Father and Son
item.description: Officials said the father had been living in Australia since 1998, and that neither man appeared to have a criminal record before the mass shooting on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni and Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A surfer walking past police at Bondi Beach in Sydney on Monday, a day after gunmen opened fire on a Hanukkah celebration there, killing 15 people and wounding dozens of others.

item.description: Jeff Jerome and Andrea Carla Michaels make their debut as collaborators in The New York Times.

item.title: House Republicans Accuse D.C. Police of Manipulating Crime Statistics
item.description: The committee cited interviews with police commanders in an effort to buttress President Trump’s federal takeover of law enforcement and the National Guard deployment in the capital city.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim
item.category: US Federal Takeover of Metropolitan Police Dept (DC)
House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The committee said interviews with the city police’s seven district commanders showed the department’s leadership had put an aggressive emphasis on lowering crime numbers.

item.title: Gunshots at Brown University, Then 12 Hours of Lockdown and Fear
item.description: Students sheltered in place in classrooms and basements, waiting for the all clear.
item.dc:creator: Mark Arsenault and Dana Goldstein

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The shooting at Brown University brought hundreds of police officers in helmets and armor to campus.

item.title: Syrian Who Killed U.S. Soldiers Was Member of Security Forces, Officials Say
item.description: The gunman who killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter had been set to be dismissed from the security forces over his extremist views, U.S. and Syrian officials said.
item.dc:creator: Euan Ward and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:credit: Delil Souleiman/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: U.S. soldiers on patrol in northeastern Syria in January.

item.title: ‘Anna Christie’ Review: Michelle Williams on the Waterfront
item.description: The actress stars in Thomas Kail’s luminous revival of Eugene O’Neill’s play about a woman whose past threatens her future.
item.dc:creator: Laura Collins-Hughes

media:content.media:credit: Sara Krulwich/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Michelle Williams in the 1921 drama “Anna Christie” at St. Ann’s Warehouse in Brooklyn.

item.title: What to Know About the Victims of the Bondi Beach Shooting
item.description: At least 15 people were killed in the attack in Sydney, including a long-serving rabbi in Bondi and a Holocaust survivor.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Kwai

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Emergency services responding at the scene of a shooting on Bondi Beach, in Sydney, on Sunday.

item.title: A Hanukkah Attack in Sydney
item.description: Gunmen killed at least 15 people attending a Jewish celebration at the city’s popular Bondi Beach in what Australian officials are calling a terrorist attack.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, yesterday.

item.title: U.S. Rabbis React to Deadly Hanukkah Attack in Sydney
item.description: After gunmen opened fire at a Hanukkah celebration in Australia, rabbis across the United States reflected on how to protect their congregations during their own events.
item.dc:creator: Jonah E. Bromwich

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The aftermath of a deadly shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, on Monday.

item.title: Inside the Clintons’ Fight to Avoid Testifying in the House Epstein Inquiry
item.description: Bill and Hillary Clinton have repeatedly offered to provide sworn statements, but Representative James R. Comer has threatened to hold them in contempt of Congress if they fail to appear.
item.dc:creator: Annie Karni
item.category: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media:content.media:credit: Melina Mara
media:content.media:description: For months, the Clintons have been engaging with Mr. Comer far more than was previously known to respond to his requests and avoid having to appear on Capitol Hill.

item.title: Muere Abraham Quintanilla Jr., padre de Selena
item.description: De adolescente, esperaba triunfar en el mundo de la música tejana. Realizó ese sueño a través de su hija.
item.dc:creator: Jesus Jiménez

media:content.media:credit: Paul Iverson/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Abraham Quintanilla Jr. en 2017. Convirtió a su pequeño grupo familiar, en el que su hija Selena cantaba, en una banda ganadora de un Grammy, y Selena llegó a ser conocida como la reina de la música tejana.

item.title: Surveillance Never Looked So Good
item.description: Charisse Pearlina Weston turns nefarious materials developed to monitor people into precarious, undulating forms.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Russeth

item.title: Man Tackled and Disarmed One of the Bondi Beach Gunmen, Video Shows
item.description: The video, verified by The New York Times, shows a man sneaking up on one of the shooters who targeted a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Nierenberg

item.title: Inside the Bondi Beach Attack at a Hanukkah Event in Australia: Maps and Videos
item.description: Two suspects opened fire from a footbridge at hundreds of people who had gathered for a Hanukkah celebration.
item.dc:creator: Weiyi Cai, Damien Cave and Malachy Browne

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: How the Deadly Shooting in Sydney Unfolded
item.description: More than a dozen people were killed and several dozen were injured at Bondi Beach in Sydney on Sunday, after what officials said was a terrorist attack on Jewish Australians.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal, Jiawei Wang, Devon Lum, McKinnon de Kuyper and Shawn Paik

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times

item.title: Watch Live: Officials Give an Update on the Brown Shooting
item.description: Officials provide an update on the shooting that happened at Brown University on Saturday.

item.title: Tiroteo en Bondi Beach: lo que hay que saber
item.description: Dos atacantes abrieron fuego contra decenas de personas durante un acto relacionado con una festividad judía. Al menos 15 personas murieron en el ataque, y también uno de los atacantes, dijo la policía.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Paramédicos esperan para ayudar a otros equipos de emergencia en el lugar de un tiroteo en Sídney, Australia, el domingo.

item.title: Zelensky Offers Compromise for New Round of Ukraine Peace Talks
item.description: Ukraine’s president met with U.S. negotiators about plans to end the war with Russia. He said he would give up hopes of joining NATO in exchange for security guarantees.
item.dc:creator: Kim Barker

media:content.media:credit: Guido Bergmann/German Government Press Office, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Steve Witkoff, the American special envoy, left, greeting President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine in Berlin on Sunday.

item.title: Los mejores álbumes de jazz de 2025
item.description: La tendencia de este año fue un indicador de la forma en que el jazz se renueva constantemente a través de una conversación continua entre las generaciones.
item.dc:creator: Hank Shteamer

item.title: Easy Chewy Chai Gingerbread Cookies Recipe

item.title: Brown Canceled Classes and Exams for the Rest of the Semester
item.description: The term, scheduled to end on Friday, has been cut short, and school officials said students could go home immediately.
item.dc:creator: Mark Arsenault

media:content.media:credit: Steven Senne/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Brown University canceled classes for the remainder of the fall semester because of a shooting on campus.

item.title: A Moral Reckoning on Immigration
item.description: How we do we treat a stranger, to whom we are obligated and what constitutes human dignity? The debates are dividing Christian denominations.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Jackson

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: In Chicago.

item.title: Live Updates: Police Say They Are Still Searching for Brown University Gunman
item.description: Officials said Sunday night that they would release a person of interest they had detained earlier. They did not identify any other suspects.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
